channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report X-2024060462
item.description:
Report X-2024060462

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE AND ORGANIC PEROXIDE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS, RESPONDER RESPONDED TO TRAILER, PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024060041
item.description:
Report E-2024060041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-13T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: SALT LAKE CTY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, eight (8) one-gallon pails of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately 0.2 gallons of product to the trailer floor and cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails and all impacted material were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060073
item.description:
Report E-2024060073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1123 were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1123-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, as well as the impacted pallet, and damaged product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums which were staged onsite for future disposal.
